archetype_name: Family Light & Fresh: Japanese and Vietnamese Weeknights
name: Chicken & Herb Fresh Rice Paper Rolls with Lime-Garlic Dip (No Soy, No Nuts)
description: Light Vietnamese-style fresh rolls with juicy chicken, crisp veggies, and fragrant herbs served with a tangy lime-garlic dip. Mild, fresh, and family-friendly.
prep_steps: Wash and dry romaine lettuce, mint, basil, cucumber, and carrots.
Shred or tear romaine lettuce into long strips.
Julienne cucumber and carrots into thin matchsticks.
Pick mint and basil leaves from stems.
Trim excess fat from chicken thighs and slice into thin strips.
Mince 3 cloves garlic; divide: 2 cloves for chicken, 1 clove for the dip.
Set a wide, microwave-safe bowl of water (about 6 cups) to heat in the microwave until very warm (not boiling), 2–3 minutes.
Place rice paper wrappers, herbs, veggies, and a clean board or damp kitchen towel at your rolling station.
cook_steps: Cook the rice vermicelli: Place in a pot, cover with boiling water, and cook per pack (usually 3–4 minutes) until tender; drain and rinse under cold water.

Cook the chicken: Heat canola oil in a large skillet over medium-high. Add chicken, 2 minced garlic cloves, a pinch of salt, and black pepper. Stir-fry 5–7 minutes until cooked through; set aside to cool slightly.
Make the dip: In a small bowl, combine lime juice, rice vinegar, honey, 1 minced garlic clove, a pinch of salt, and 2–3 tablespoons water. Adjust to taste with more water for milder acidity.
Assemble rolls (work one at a time): Dip a rice paper wrapper in the warm water for 5–10 seconds and lay it on the board.
Layer a small handful of lettuce, a few mint and basil leaves, some cucumber and carrots, a small bundle of vermicelli, and a few strips of chicken in the lower third of the wrapper.
Roll: Fold the sides over, then roll up tightly from the bottom to seal. Repeat with remaining wrappers and fillings.
Serve the fresh rolls with the lime-garlic dip.
